member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.#ctor(System.String,Tinkerforge.IPConnection)
member.summary: Creates an object with the unique device ID uid and adds it to the IPConnection ipcon.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.GetAllValues(System.Int32@,System.Int16@,System.Int32@)
member.summary:
Returns all values measured by the CO2 Bricklet 2.0. The values are CO2 concentration (in ppm), temperature (in 0.01 °C) and humidity (in 0.01 %RH).
If you want to get the values periodically, it is recommended to use the callback. You can set the callback configuration with .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.SetAirPressure(System.Int32)
member.summary:
The CO2 concentration (among other things) depends on the ambient air pressure.
To increase the accuracy of the CO2 Bricklet 2.0 you can set the current air pressure. You use the :ref:`Barometer Bricklet 2.0 <barometer_v2_bricklet>` or the :ref:`Air Quality Bricklet <air_quality_bricklet>` to get the current air pressure.
The expected unit of the ambient air pressure value is mbar.
By default air pressure compensation is disabled. Once you set a value it will be used for compensation. You can turn the compensation off again by setting the value to 0.
It is sufficient to update the value every few minutes.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.GetAirPressure
member.summary: Returns the ambient air pressure as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.SetTemperatureOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets a temperature offset with resolution 1/100°C. A offset of 10 will decrease the measured temperature by 0.1°C.
If you install this Bricklet into an enclosure and you want to measure the ambient temperature, you may have to decrease the measured temperature by some value to compensate for the error because of the heating inside of the enclosure.
We recommend that you leave the parts in the enclosure running for at least 24 hours such that a temperature equilibrium can be reached. After that you can measure the temperature directly outside of enclosure and set the difference as offset.
This temperature offset is used to calculate the relative humidity and CO2 concentration. In case the Bricklet is installed in an enclosure, we recommend to measure and set the temperature offset to improve the accuracy of the measurements.
It is sufficient to set the temperature offset once. The offset is saved in non-volatile memory and is applied again after a power loss.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.GetTemperatureOffset
member.summary: Returns the temperature offset as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.SetAllValuesCallbackConfiguration(System.Int64,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
The period in ms is the period with which the callback is triggered periodically. A value of 0 turns the callback off.
If the `value has to change`-parameter is set to true, the callback is only triggered after at least one of the values has changed. If the values didn't change within the period, the callback is triggered immediately on change.
If it is set to false, the callback is continuously triggered with the period, independent of the value.
The default value is (0, false).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.GetAllValuesCallbackConfiguration(System.Int64@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Returns the callback configuration as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.GetCO2Concentration
member.summary:
Returns CO2 concentration in ppm.
If you want to get the value periodically, it is recommended to use the callback. You can set the callback configuration with .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.SetCO2ConcentrationCallbackConfiguration(System.Int64,System.Boolean,System.Char,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
The period in ms is the period with which the callback is triggered periodically. A value of 0 turns the callback off.
If the `value has to change`-parameter is set to true, the callback is only triggered after the value has changed. If the value didn't change within the period, the callback is triggered immediately on change.
If it is set to false, the callback is continuously triggered with the period, independent of the value.
It is furthermore possible to constrain the callback with thresholds.
The `option`-parameter together with min/max sets a threshold for the callback.
The following options are possible:
"Option", "Description"
"'x'", "Threshold is turned off" "'o'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is *outside* the min and max values" "'i'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is *inside* or equal to the min and max values" "'<'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is smaller than the min value (max is ignored)" "'>'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is greater than the min value (max is ignored)"
If the option is set to 'x' (threshold turned off) the callback is triggered with the fixed period.
The default value is (0, false, 'x', 0, 0).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.GetCO2ConcentrationCallbackConfiguration(System.Int64@,System.Boolean@,System.Char@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the callback configuration as set by .

If it is set to false, the callback is continuously triggered with the period, independent of the value.
It is furthermore possible to constrain the callback with thresholds.
The `option`-parameter together with min/max sets a threshold for the callback.
The following options are possible:
"Option", "Description"
"'x'", "Threshold is turned off" "'o'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is *outside* the min and max values" "'i'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is *inside* or equal to the min and max values" "'<'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is smaller than the min value (max is ignored)" "'>'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is greater than the min value (max is ignored)"
If the option is set to 'x' (threshold turned off) the callback is triggered with the fixed period.
The default value is (0, false, 'x', 0, 0).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.GetSPITFPErrorCount(System.Int64@,System.Int64@,System.Int64@,System.Int64@)
member.summary:
Returns the error count for the communication between Brick and Bricklet.
The errors are divided into
* ACK checksum errors, * message checksum errors, * framing errors and * overflow errors.
The errors counts are for errors that occur on the Bricklet side. All Bricks have a similar function that returns the errors on the Brick side.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.SetBootloaderMode(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the bootloader mode and returns the status after the requested mode change was instigated.
You can change from bootloader mode to firmware mode and vice versa. A change from bootloader mode to firmware mode will only take place if the entry function, device identifier and CRC are present and correct.
This function is used by Brick Viewer during flashing. It should not be necessary to call it in a normal user program.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.GetBootloaderMode
member.summary: Returns the current bootloader mode, see .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.SetWriteFirmwarePointer(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Sets the firmware pointer for . The pointer has to be increased by chunks of size 64. The data is written to flash every 4 chunks (which equals to one page of size 256).
This function is used by Brick Viewer during flashing. It should not be necessary to call it in a normal user program.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.WriteFirmware(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Writes 64 Bytes of firmware at the position as written by before. The firmware is written to flash every 4 chunks.
You can only write firmware in bootloader mode.
This function is used by Brick Viewer during flashing. It should not be necessary to call it in a normal user program.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.SetStatusLEDConfig(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the status LED configuration. By default the LED shows communication traffic between Brick and Bricklet, it flickers once for every 10 received data packets.
You can also turn the LED permanently on/off or show a heartbeat.
If the Bricklet is in bootloader mode, the LED is will show heartbeat by default.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.GetStatusLEDConfig
member.summary: Returns the configuration as set by

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.GetChipTemperature
member.summary:
Returns the temperature in °C as measured inside the microcontroller. The value returned is not the ambient temperature!
The temperature is only proportional to the real temperature and it has bad accuracy. Practically it is only useful as an indicator for temperature changes.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.Reset
member.summary:
Calling this function will reset the Bricklet. All configurations will be lost.
After a reset you have to create new device objects, calling functions on the existing ones will result in undefined behavior!

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.WriteUID(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Writes a new UID into flash. If you want to set a new UID you have to decode the Base58 encoded UID string into an integer first.
We recommend that you use Brick Viewer to change the UID.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.ReadUID
member.summary: Returns the current UID as an integer. Encode as Base58 to get the usual string version.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCO2V2.GetIdentity(System.String@,System.String@,System.Char@,System.Byte[]@,System.Byte[]@,System.Int32@)
member.summary:
Returns the UID, the UID where the Bricklet is connected to, the position, the hardware and firmware version as well as the device identifier.
The position can be 'a', 'b', 'c' or 'd'.
The device identifier numbers can be found :ref:`here <device_identifier>`. |device_identifier_constant|

member.name: E:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.ColorCallback
member.summary:
This callback is triggered periodically with the period that is set by . The parameter is the color of the sensor as RGBC.
The callback is only triggered if the color has changed since the last triggering.

member.name: E:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.ColorReachedCallback
member.summary:
This callback is triggered when the threshold as set by is reached. The parameter is the color of the sensor as RGBC.
If the threshold keeps being reached, the callback is triggered periodically with the period as set by .

member.name: E:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.IlluminanceCallback
member.summary:
This callback is triggered periodically with the period that is set by . The parameter is the illuminance. See for how to interpret this value.
The callback is only triggered if the illuminance has changed since the last triggering.

member.name: E:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.ColorTemperatureCallback
member.summary:
This callback is triggered periodically with the period that is set by . The parameter is the color temperature in Kelvin.
The callback is only triggered if the color temperature has changed since the last triggering.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.#ctor(System.String,Tinkerforge.IPConnection)
member.summary: Creates an object with the unique device ID uid and adds it to the IPConnection ipcon.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.GetColor(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary:
Returns the measured color of the sensor. The values have a range of 0 to 65535.
The red (r), green (g), blue (b) and clear (c) colors are measured with four different photodiodes that are responsive at different wavelengths:
.. image:: /Images/Bricklets/bricklet_color_wavelength_chart_600.jpg :scale: 100 % :alt: Chart Responsivity / Wavelength :align: center :target: ../../_images/Bricklets/bricklet_color_wavelength_chart_600.jpg
If you want to get the color periodically, it is recommended to use the callback and set the period with .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.SetColorCallbackPeriod(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Sets the period in ms with which the callback is triggered periodically. A value of 0 turns the callback off.
The callback is only triggered if the color has changed since the last triggering.
The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.GetColorCallbackPeriod
member.summary: Returns the period as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.SetColorCallbackThreshold(System.Char,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the thresholds for the callback.
The following options are possible:
"Option", "Description"
"'x'", "Callback is turned off" "'o'", "Callback is triggered when the temperature is *outside* the min and max values" "'i'", "Callback is triggered when the temperature is *inside* the min and max values" "'<'", "Callback is triggered when the temperature is smaller than the min value (max is ignored)" "'>'", "Callback is triggered when the temperature is greater than the min value (max is ignored)"
The default value is ('x', 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.GetColorCallbackThreshold(System.Char@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the threshold as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.SetDebouncePeriod(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Sets the period in ms with which the threshold callback
*
is triggered, if the threshold
*
keeps being reached.
The default value is 100.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.GetDebouncePeriod
member.summary: Returns the debounce period as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.LightOn
member.summary: Turns the LED on.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.LightOff
member.summary: Turns the LED off.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.IsLightOn
member.summary:
Returns the state of the LED. Possible values are:
* 0: On * 1: Off

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.SetConfig(System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the configuration of the sensor. Gain and integration time can be configured in this way.
For configuring the gain:
* 0: 1x Gain * 1: 4x Gain * 2: 16x Gain * 3: 60x Gain
For configuring the integration time:
* 0: 2.4ms * 1: 24ms * 2: 101ms * 3: 154ms * 4: 700ms
Increasing the gain enables the sensor to detect a color from a higher distance.
The integration time provides a trade-off between conversion time and accuracy. With a longer integration time the values read will be more accurate but it will take longer time to get the conversion results.
The default values are 60x gain and 154ms integration time.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.GetConfig(System.Byte@,System.Byte@)
member.summary: Returns the configuration as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.GetIlluminance
member.summary:
Returns the illuminance affected by the gain and integration time as set by . To get the illuminance in Lux apply this formula::
lux = illuminance * 700 / gain / integration_time
To get a correct illuminance measurement make sure that the color values themselves are not saturated. The color value (R, G or B) is saturated if it is equal to the maximum value of 65535. In that case you have to reduce the gain, see .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.GetColorTemperature
member.summary:
Returns the color temperature in Kelvin.
To get a correct color temperature measurement make sure that the color values themselves are not saturated. The color value (R, G or B) is saturated if it is equal to the maximum value of 65535. In that case you have to reduce the gain, see .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.SetIlluminanceCallbackPeriod(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Sets the period in ms with which the callback is triggered periodically. A value of 0 turns the callback off.
The callback is only triggered if the illuminance has changed since the last triggering.
The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.GetIlluminanceCallbackPeriod
member.summary: Returns the period as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.SetColorTemperatureCallbackPeriod(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Sets the period in ms with which the callback is triggered periodically. A value of 0 turns the callback off.
The callback is only triggered if the color temperature has changed since the last triggering.
The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColor.GetColorTemperatureCallbackPeriod
member.summary: Returns the period as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.#ctor(System.String,Tinkerforge.IPConnection)
member.summary: Creates an object with the unique device ID uid and adds it to the IPConnection ipcon.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.GetColor(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary:
Returns the measured color of the sensor. The values have a range of 0 to 65535.
The red (r), green (g), blue (b) and clear (c) colors are measured with four different photodiodes that are responsive at different wavelengths:
.. image:: /Images/Bricklets/bricklet_color_wavelength_chart_600.jpg :scale: 100 % :alt: Chart Responsivity / Wavelength :align: center :target: ../../_images/Bricklets/bricklet_color_wavelength_chart_600.jpg
If you want to get the color periodically, it is recommended to use the callback and set the period with .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.SetColorCallbackConfiguration(System.Int64,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
The period in ms is the period with which the callback is triggered periodically. A value of 0 turns the callback off.
If the `value has to change`-parameter is set to true, the callback is only triggered after the value has changed. If the value didn't change within the period, the callback is triggered immediately on change.
If it is set to false, the callback is continuously triggered with the period, independent of the value.
The default value is (0, false).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.GetColorCallbackConfiguration(System.Int64@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Returns the callback configuration as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.GetIlluminance
member.summary:
Returns the illuminance affected by the gain and integration time as set by . To get the illuminance in Lux apply this formula::
lux = illuminance * 700 / gain / integration_time
To get a correct illuminance measurement make sure that the color values themselves are not saturated. The color value (R, G or B) is saturated if it is equal to the maximum value of 65535. In that case you have to reduce the gain, see .
If you want to get the value periodically, it is recommended to use the callback. You can set the callback configuration with .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.SetIlluminanceCallbackConfiguration(System.Int64,System.Boolean,System.Char,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary:
The period in ms is the period with which the callback is triggered periodically. A value of 0 turns the callback off.
If the `value has to change`-parameter is set to true, the callback is only triggered after the value has changed. If the value didn't change within the period, the callback is triggered immediately on change.
If it is set to false, the callback is continuously triggered with the period, independent of the value.
It is furthermore possible to constrain the callback with thresholds.
The `option`-parameter together with min/max sets a threshold for the callback.
The following options are possible:
"Option", "Description"
"'x'", "Threshold is turned off" "'o'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is *outside* the min and max values" "'i'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is *inside* or equal to the min and max values" "'<'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is smaller than the min value (max is ignored)" "'>'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is greater than the min value (max is ignored)"
If the option is set to 'x' (threshold turned off) the callback is triggered with the fixed period.
The default value is (0, false, 'x', 0, 0).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.GetIlluminanceCallbackConfiguration(System.Int64@,System.Boolean@,System.Char@,System.Int64@,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Returns the callback configuration as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.GetColorTemperature
member.summary:
Returns the color temperature in Kelvin.
To get a correct color temperature measurement make sure that the color values themselves are not saturated. The color value (R, G or B) is saturated if it is equal to the maximum value of 65535. In that case you have to reduce the gain, see .
If you want to get the value periodically, it is recommended to use the callback. You can set the callback configuration with .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.SetColorTemperatureCallbackConfiguration(System.Int64,System.Boolean,System.Char,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
The period in ms is the period with which the callback is triggered periodically. A value of 0 turns the callback off.
If the `value has to change`-parameter is set to true, the callback is only triggered after the value has changed. If the value didn't change within the period, the callback is triggered immediately on change.
If it is set to false, the callback is continuously triggered with the period, independent of the value.
It is furthermore possible to constrain the callback with thresholds.
The `option`-parameter together with min/max sets a threshold for the callback.
The following options are possible:
"Option", "Description"
"'x'", "Threshold is turned off" "'o'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is *outside* the min and max values" "'i'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is *inside* or equal to the min and max values" "'<'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is smaller than the min value (max is ignored)" "'>'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is greater than the min value (max is ignored)"
If the option is set to 'x' (threshold turned off) the callback is triggered with the fixed period.
The default value is (0, false, 'x', 0, 0).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.GetColorTemperatureCallbackConfiguration(System.Int64@,System.Boolean@,System.Char@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the callback configuration as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.SetConfiguration(System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the configuration of the sensor. Gain and integration time can be configured this way.
For configuring the gain:
* 0: 1x Gain * 1: 4x Gain * 2: 16x Gain * 3: 60x Gain
For configuring the integration time:
* 0: 2.4ms * 1: 24ms * 2: 101ms * 3: 154ms * 4: 700ms
Increasing the gain enables the sensor to detect a color from a higher distance.
The integration time provides a trade-off between conversion time and accuracy. With a longer integration time the values read will be more accurate but it will take longer to get the conversion results.
The default values are 60x gain and 154ms integration time.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.GetConfiguration(System.Byte@,System.Byte@)
member.summary: Returns the configuration as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.GetSPITFPErrorCount(System.Int64@,System.Int64@,System.Int64@,System.Int64@)
member.summary:
Returns the error count for the communication between Brick and Bricklet.
The errors are divided into
* ACK checksum errors, * message checksum errors, * framing errors and * overflow errors.
The errors counts are for errors that occur on the Bricklet side. All Bricks have a similar function that returns the errors on the Brick side.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.SetBootloaderMode(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the bootloader mode and returns the status after the requested mode change was instigated.
You can change from bootloader mode to firmware mode and vice versa. A change from bootloader mode to firmware mode will only take place if the entry function, device identifier and CRC are present and correct.
This function is used by Brick Viewer during flashing. It should not be necessary to call it in a normal user program.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.GetBootloaderMode
member.summary: Returns the current bootloader mode, see .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.SetWriteFirmwarePointer(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Sets the firmware pointer for . The pointer has to be increased by chunks of size 64. The data is written to flash every 4 chunks (which equals to one page of size 256).
This function is used by Brick Viewer during flashing. It should not be necessary to call it in a normal user program.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.WriteFirmware(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Writes 64 Bytes of firmware at the position as written by before. The firmware is written to flash every 4 chunks.
You can only write firmware in bootloader mode.
This function is used by Brick Viewer during flashing. It should not be necessary to call it in a normal user program.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.SetStatusLEDConfig(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the status LED configuration. By default the LED shows communication traffic between Brick and Bricklet, it flickers once for every 10 received data packets.
You can also turn the LED permanently on/off or show a heartbeat.
If the Bricklet is in bootloader mode, the LED is will show heartbeat by default.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.GetStatusLEDConfig
member.summary: Returns the configuration as set by

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.GetChipTemperature
member.summary:
Returns the temperature in °C as measured inside the microcontroller. The value returned is not the ambient temperature!
The temperature is only proportional to the real temperature and it has bad accuracy. Practically it is only useful as an indicator for temperature changes.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.Reset
member.summary:
Calling this function will reset the Bricklet. All configurations will be lost.
After a reset you have to create new device objects, calling functions on the existing ones will result in undefined behavior!

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.WriteUID(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Writes a new UID into flash. If you want to set a new UID you have to decode the Base58 encoded UID string into an integer first.
We recommend that you use Brick Viewer to change the UID.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletColorV2.ReadUID
member.summary: Returns the current UID as an integer. Encode as Base58 to get the usual string version.

The position can be 'a', 'b', 'c' or 'd'.
The device identifier numbers can be found :ref:`here <device_identifier>`. |device_identifier_constant|

member.summary:
This callback is triggered periodically according to the configuration set by .
The parameter is the same as .

This callback is triggered periodically according to the configuration set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.#ctor(System.String,Tinkerforge.IPConnection)
member.summary: Creates an object with the unique device ID uid and adds it to the IPConnection ipcon.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.GetHeading
member.summary:
Returns the heading in 1/10 degree (north = 0 degree, east = 90 degree).
Alternatively you can use and calculate the heading with ``heading = atan2(y, x) * 180 / PI``.
If you want to get the value periodically, it is recommended to use the callback. You can set the callback configuration with .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.SetHeadingCallbackConfiguration(System.Int64,System.Boolean,System.Char,System.Int16,System.Int16)
member.summary:
The period in ms is the period with which the callback is triggered periodically. A value of 0 turns the callback off.
If the `value has to change`-parameter is set to true, the callback is only triggered after the value has changed. If the value didn't change within the period, the callback is triggered immediately on change.
If it is set to false, the callback is continuously triggered with the period, independent of the value.
It is furthermore possible to constrain the callback with thresholds.
The `option`-parameter together with min/max sets a threshold for the callback.
The following options are possible:
"Option", "Description"
"'x'", "Threshold is turned off" "'o'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is *outside* the min and max values" "'i'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is *inside* or equal to the min and max values" "'<'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is smaller than the min value (max is ignored)" "'>'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is greater than the min value (max is ignored)"
If the option is set to 'x' (threshold turned off) the callback is triggered with the fixed period.
The default value is (0, false, 'x', 0, 0).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.GetHeadingCallbackConfiguration(System.Int64@,System.Boolean@,System.Char@,System.Int16@,System.Int16@)
member.summary: Returns the callback configuration as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.GetMagneticFluxDensity(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary:
Returns the `magnetic flux density (magnetic induction) <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnetic_flux>`__ for all three axis in 1/10 `mG (milli Gauss) <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gauss_(unit)>`__.
If you want to get the value periodically, it is recommended to use the callback. You can set the callback configuration with .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.SetMagneticFluxDensityCallbackConfiguration(System.Int64,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
The period in ms is the period with which the callback is triggered periodically. A value of 0 turns the callback off.
If the `value has to change`-parameter is set to true, the callback is only triggered after the value has changed. If the value didn't change within the period, the callback is triggered immediately on change.
If it is set to false, the callback is continuously triggered with the period, independent of the value.
The default value is (0, false).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.GetMagneticFluxDensityCallbackConfiguration(System.Int64@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Returns the callback configuration as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.SetConfiguration(System.Byte,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Configures the data rate and background calibration.
* Data Rate: Sets the data rate that is used by the magnetometer. The lower the data rate, the lower is the noise on the data. * Background Calibration: Set to *true* to enable the background calibration and *false* to turn it off. If the background calibration is enabled the sensing polarity is flipped once per second to automatically calculate and remove offset that is caused by temperature changes. This polarity flipping takes about 20ms. This means that once a second you will not get new data for a period of 20ms. We highly recommend that you keep the background calibration enabled and only disable it if the 20ms off-time is a problem in your application.
Default values: Data rate of 100Hz and background calibration enabled.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.GetConfiguration(System.Byte@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Returns the configuration as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.SetCalibration(System.Int16[],System.Int16[])
member.summary:
Sets offset and gain for each of the three axes.
The Bricklet is factory calibrated. If you want to re-calibrate the Bricklet we recommend that you do the calibration through Brick Viewer.
The calibration is saved in non-volatile memory and only has to be done once.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.GetCalibration(System.Int16[]@,System.Int16[]@)
member.summary: Returns the calibration parameters as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.GetSPITFPErrorCount(System.Int64@,System.Int64@,System.Int64@,System.Int64@)
member.summary:
Returns the error count for the communication between Brick and Bricklet.
The errors are divided into
* ACK checksum errors, * message checksum errors, * framing errors and * overflow errors.
The errors counts are for errors that occur on the Bricklet side. All Bricks have a similar function that returns the errors on the Brick side.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.SetBootloaderMode(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the bootloader mode and returns the status after the requested mode change was instigated.
You can change from bootloader mode to firmware mode and vice versa. A change from bootloader mode to firmware mode will only take place if the entry function, device identifier and CRC are present and correct.
This function is used by Brick Viewer during flashing. It should not be necessary to call it in a normal user program.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.GetBootloaderMode
member.summary: Returns the current bootloader mode, see .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.SetWriteFirmwarePointer(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Sets the firmware pointer for . The pointer has to be increased by chunks of size 64. The data is written to flash every 4 chunks (which equals to one page of size 256).
This function is used by Brick Viewer during flashing. It should not be necessary to call it in a normal user program.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.WriteFirmware(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Writes 64 Bytes of firmware at the position as written by before. The firmware is written to flash every 4 chunks.
You can only write firmware in bootloader mode.
This function is used by Brick Viewer during flashing. It should not be necessary to call it in a normal user program.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.SetStatusLEDConfig(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the status LED configuration. By default the LED shows communication traffic between Brick and Bricklet, it flickers once for every 10 received data packets.
You can also turn the LED permanently on/off or show a heartbeat.
If the Bricklet is in bootloader mode, the LED is will show heartbeat by default.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.GetStatusLEDConfig
member.summary: Returns the configuration as set by

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.GetChipTemperature
member.summary:
Returns the temperature in °C as measured inside the microcontroller. The value returned is not the ambient temperature!
The temperature is only proportional to the real temperature and it has bad accuracy. Practically it is only useful as an indicator for temperature changes.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.Reset
member.summary:
Calling this function will reset the Bricklet. All configurations will be lost.
After a reset you have to create new device objects, calling functions on the existing ones will result in undefined behavior!

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.WriteUID(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Writes a new UID into flash. If you want to set a new UID you have to decode the Base58 encoded UID string into an integer first.
We recommend that you use Brick Viewer to change the UID.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.ReadUID
member.summary: Returns the current UID as an integer. Encode as Base58 to get the usual string version.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCompass.GetIdentity(System.String@,System.String@,System.Char@,System.Byte[]@,System.Byte[]@,System.Int32@)
member.summary:
Returns the UID, the UID where the Bricklet is connected to, the position, the hardware and firmware version as well as the device identifier.
The position can be 'a', 'b', 'c' or 'd'.
The device identifier numbers can be found :ref:`here <device_identifier>`. |device_identifier_constant|

member.summary:
This callback is triggered periodically with the period that is set by . The parameter is the current of the sensor.
The callback is only triggered if the current has changed since the last triggering.

member.name: E:Tinkerforge.BrickletCurrent12.AnalogValueCallback
member.summary:
This callback is triggered periodically with the period that is set by . The parameter is the analog value of the sensor.
The callback is only triggered if the current has changed since the last triggering.

member.name: E:Tinkerforge.BrickletCurrent12.CurrentReachedCallback
member.summary:
This callback is triggered when the threshold as set by is reached. The parameter is the current of the sensor.
If the threshold keeps being reached, the callback is triggered periodically with the period as set by .

member.name: E:Tinkerforge.BrickletCurrent12.AnalogValueReachedCallback
member.summary:
This callback is triggered when the threshold as set by is reached. The parameter is the analog value of the sensor.

member.summary: This callback is triggered when an over current is measured (see ).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCurrent12.#ctor(System.String,Tinkerforge.IPConnection)
member.summary: Creates an object with the unique device ID uid and adds it to the IPConnection ipcon.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCurrent12.GetCurrent
member.summary:
Returns the current of the sensor. The value is in mA and between -12500mA and 12500mA.
If you want to get the current periodically, it is recommended to use the callback and set the period with .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCurrent12.Calibrate
member.summary:
Calibrates the 0 value of the sensor. You have to call this function when there is no current present.
The zero point of the current sensor is depending on the exact properties of the analog-to-digital converter, the length of the Bricklet cable and the temperature. Thus, if you change the Brick or the environment in which the Bricklet is used, you might have to recalibrate.
The resulting calibration will be saved on the EEPROM of the Current Bricklet.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCurrent12.IsOverCurrent
member.summary:
Returns *true* if more than 12.5A were measured.
To reset this value you have to power cycle the Bricklet.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCurrent12.GetAnalogValue
member.summary:
Returns the value as read by a 12-bit analog-to-digital converter. The value is between 0 and 4095.
The value returned by is averaged over several samples to yield less noise, while gives back raw unfiltered analog values. The only reason to use is, if you need the full resolution of the analog-to-digital converter.
If you want the analog value periodically, it is recommended to use the callback and set the period with .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCurrent12.SetCurrentCallbackPeriod(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Sets the period in ms with which the callback is triggered periodically. A value of 0 turns the callback off.
The callback is only triggered if the current has changed since the last triggering.
The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCurrent12.GetCurrentCallbackPeriod
member.summary: Returns the period as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCurrent12.SetAnalogValueCallbackPeriod(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Sets the period in ms with which the callback is triggered periodically. A value of 0 turns the callback off.
The callback is only triggered if the analog value has changed since the last triggering.
The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletCurrent12.GetAnalogValueCallbackPeriod
member.summary: Returns the period as set by .

member.summary:
Sets the thresholds for the callback.
The following options are possible:
"Option", "Description"
"'x'", "Callback is turned off" "'o'", "Callback is triggered when the current is *outside* the min and max values" "'i'", "Callback is triggered when the current is *inside* the min and max values" "'<'", "Callback is triggered when the current is smaller than the min value (max is ignored)" "'>'", "Callback is triggered when the current is greater than the min value (max is ignored)"
The default value is ('x', 0, 0).

member.name: E:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIR.DistanceCallback
member.summary:
This callback is triggered periodically with the period that is set by . The parameter is the distance of the sensor.
The callback is only triggered if the distance has changed since the last triggering.

member.name: E:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIR.AnalogValueCallback
member.summary:
This callback is triggered periodically with the period that is set by . The parameter is the analog value of the sensor.
The callback is only triggered if the analog value has changed since the last triggering.

member.name: E:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIR.DistanceReachedCallback
member.summary:
This callback is triggered when the threshold as set by is reached. The parameter is the distance of the sensor.
If the threshold keeps being reached, the callback is triggered periodically with the period as set by .

member.name: E:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIR.AnalogValueReachedCallback
member.summary:
This callback is triggered when the threshold as set by is reached. The parameter is the analog value of the sensor.
If the threshold keeps being reached, the callback is triggered periodically with the period as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIR.#ctor(System.String,Tinkerforge.IPConnection)
member.summary: Creates an object with the unique device ID uid and adds it to the IPConnection ipcon.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIR.GetDistance
member.summary:
Returns the distance measured by the sensor. The value is in mm and possible distance ranges are 40 to 300, 100 to 800 and 200 to 1500, depending on the selected IR sensor.
If you want to get the distance periodically, it is recommended to use the callback and set the period with .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIR.GetAnalogValue
member.summary:
Returns the value as read by a 12-bit analog-to-digital converter. The value is between 0 and 4095.
The value returned by is averaged over several samples to yield less noise, while gives back raw unfiltered analog values. The only reason to use is, if you need the full resolution of the analog-to-digital converter.
If you want the analog value periodically, it is recommended to use the callback and set the period with .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIR.SetSamplingPoint(System.Byte,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets a sampling point value to a specific position of the lookup table. The lookup table comprises 128 equidistant analog values with corresponding distances.
If you measure a distance of 50cm at the analog value 2048, you should call this function with (64, 5000). The utilized analog-to-digital converter has a resolution of 12 bit. With 128 sampling points on the whole range, this means that every sampling point has a size of 32 analog values. Thus the analog value 2048 has the corresponding sampling point 64 = 2048/32.
Sampling points are saved on the EEPROM of the Distance IR Bricklet and loaded again on startup.
An easy way to calibrate the sampling points of the Distance IR Bricklet is implemented in the Brick Viewer. If you want to calibrate your Bricklet it is highly recommended to use this implementation.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIR.GetSamplingPoint(System.Byte)
member.summary: Returns the distance to a sampling point position as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIR.SetDistanceCallbackPeriod(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Sets the period in ms with which the callback is triggered periodically. A value of 0 turns the callback off.
The callback is only triggered if the distance has changed since the last triggering.
The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIR.GetDistanceCallbackPeriod
member.summary: Returns the period as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIR.SetAnalogValueCallbackPeriod(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Sets the period in ms with which the callback is triggered periodically. A value of 0 turns the callback off.
The callback is only triggered if the analog value has changed since the last triggering.
The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIR.GetAnalogValueCallbackPeriod
member.summary: Returns the period as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIR.SetDistanceCallbackThreshold(System.Char,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the thresholds for the callback.
The following options are possible:
"Option", "Description"
"'x'", "Callback is turned off" "'o'", "Callback is triggered when the distance is *outside* the min and max values" "'i'", "Callback is triggered when the distance is *inside* the min and max values" "'<'", "Callback is triggered when the distance is smaller than the min value (max is ignored)" "'>'", "Callback is triggered when the distance is greater than the min value (max is ignored)"
The default value is ('x', 0, 0).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIR.GetDistanceCallbackThreshold(System.Char@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the threshold as set by .

The default value is ('x', 0, 0).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.#ctor(System.String,Tinkerforge.IPConnection)
member.summary: Creates an object with the unique device ID uid and adds it to the IPConnection ipcon.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.GetDistance
member.summary:
Returns the distance measured by the sensor. The value is in mm and possible distance ranges are 40 to 300, 100 to 800 and 200 to 1500, depending on the selected IR sensor.
If you want to get the value periodically, it is recommended to use the callback. You can set the callback configuration with .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.SetDistanceCallbackConfiguration(System.Int64,System.Boolean,System.Char,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
The period in ms is the period with which the callback is triggered periodically. A value of 0 turns the callback off.
If the `value has to change`-parameter is set to true, the callback is only triggered after the value has changed. If the value didn't change within the period, the callback is triggered immediately on change.
If it is set to false, the callback is continuously triggered with the period, independent of the value.
It is furthermore possible to constrain the callback with thresholds.
The `option`-parameter together with min/max sets a threshold for the callback.
The following options are possible:
"Option", "Description"
"'x'", "Threshold is turned off" "'o'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is *outside* the min and max values" "'i'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is *inside* or equal to the min and max values" "'<'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is smaller than the min value (max is ignored)" "'>'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is greater than the min value (max is ignored)"
If the option is set to 'x' (threshold turned off) the callback is triggered with the fixed period.
The default value is (0, false, 'x', 0, 0).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.GetDistanceCallbackConfiguration(System.Int64@,System.Boolean@,System.Char@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the callback configuration as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.GetAnalogValue
member.summary:
Returns the analog value as read by a analog-to-digital converter. The value has 21 bit with a range of 0 to 2097151.
This is unfiltered raw data. We made sure that the integration time of the ADC is shorter then the measurement interval of the sensor (10ms vs 16.5ms). So there is no information lost.
If you want to do your own calibration or create your own lookup table you can use this value.
If you want to get the value periodically, it is recommended to use the callback. You can set the callback configuration with .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.SetAnalogValueCallbackConfiguration(System.Int64,System.Boolean,System.Char,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary:
The period in ms is the period with which the callback is triggered periodically. A value of 0 turns the callback off.
If the `value has to change`-parameter is set to true, the callback is only triggered after the value has changed. If the value didn't change within the period, the callback is triggered immediately on change.
If it is set to false, the callback is continuously triggered with the period, independent of the value.
It is furthermore possible to constrain the callback with thresholds.
The `option`-parameter together with min/max sets a threshold for the callback.
The following options are possible:
"Option", "Description"
"'x'", "Threshold is turned off" "'o'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is *outside* the min and max values" "'i'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is *inside* or equal to the min and max values" "'<'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is smaller than the min value (max is ignored)" "'>'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is greater than the min value (max is ignored)"
If the option is set to 'x' (threshold turned off) the callback is triggered with the fixed period.
The default value is (0, false, 'x', 0, 0).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.GetAnalogValueCallbackConfiguration(System.Int64@,System.Boolean@,System.Char@,System.Int64@,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Returns the callback configuration as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.SetMovingAverageConfiguration(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the length of a `moving averaging <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moving_average>`__ for the distance.
Setting the length to 1 will turn the averaging off. With less averaging, there is more noise on the data.
The range for the averaging is 1-1000.
New data is gathered every ~10ms. With a moving average of length 1000 the resulting averaging window has a length of approximately 10s. If you want to do long term measurements the longest moving average will give the cleanest results.
The default value is 25.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.GetMovingAverageConfiguration
member.summary: Returns the moving average configuration as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.SetDistanceLEDConfig(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Configures the distance LED to be either turned off, turned on, blink in heartbeat mode or show the distance (brighter = object is nearer).
The default value is 3 (show distance).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.GetDistanceLEDConfig
member.summary: Returns the LED configuration as set by

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.SetSensorType(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the sensor type.
The Bricklet comes configured with the correct sensor type and the type is saved in flash (i.e. the Bricklet retains the information if power is lost).
If you want to change the sensor you can set the type in Brick Viewer, you will likely never need to call this function from your program.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.GetSensorType
member.summary: Returns the sensor type as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.GetSPITFPErrorCount(System.Int64@,System.Int64@,System.Int64@,System.Int64@)
member.summary:
Returns the error count for the communication between Brick and Bricklet.
The errors are divided into
* ACK checksum errors, * message checksum errors, * framing errors and * overflow errors.
The errors counts are for errors that occur on the Bricklet side. All Bricks have a similar function that returns the errors on the Brick side.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.SetBootloaderMode(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the bootloader mode and returns the status after the requested mode change was instigated.
You can change from bootloader mode to firmware mode and vice versa. A change from bootloader mode to firmware mode will only take place if the entry function, device identifier and CRC are present and correct.
This function is used by Brick Viewer during flashing. It should not be necessary to call it in a normal user program.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.GetBootloaderMode
member.summary: Returns the current bootloader mode, see .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.SetWriteFirmwarePointer(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Sets the firmware pointer for . The pointer has to be increased by chunks of size 64. The data is written to flash every 4 chunks (which equals to one page of size 256).
This function is used by Brick Viewer during flashing. It should not be necessary to call it in a normal user program.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.WriteFirmware(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Writes 64 Bytes of firmware at the position as written by before. The firmware is written to flash every 4 chunks.
You can only write firmware in bootloader mode.
This function is used by Brick Viewer during flashing. It should not be necessary to call it in a normal user program.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.SetStatusLEDConfig(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the status LED configuration. By default the LED shows communication traffic between Brick and Bricklet, it flickers once for every 10 received data packets.
You can also turn the LED permanently on/off or show a heartbeat.
If the Bricklet is in bootloader mode, the LED is will show heartbeat by default.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.GetStatusLEDConfig
member.summary: Returns the configuration as set by

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.GetChipTemperature
member.summary:
Returns the temperature in °C as measured inside the microcontroller. The value returned is not the ambient temperature!
The temperature is only proportional to the real temperature and it has bad accuracy. Practically it is only useful as an indicator for temperature changes.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.Reset
member.summary:
Calling this function will reset the Bricklet. All configurations will be lost.
After a reset you have to create new device objects, calling functions on the existing ones will result in undefined behavior!

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.WriteUID(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Writes a new UID into flash. If you want to set a new UID you have to decode the Base58 encoded UID string into an integer first.
We recommend that you use Brick Viewer to change the UID.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceIRV2.ReadUID
member.summary: Returns the current UID as an integer. Encode as Base58 to get the usual string version.

member.summary: Creates an object with the unique device ID uid and adds it to the IPConnection ipcon.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUS.GetDistanceValue
member.summary:
Returns the current distance value measured by the sensor. The value has a range of 0 to 4095. A small value corresponds to a small distance, a big value corresponds to a big distance. The relation between the measured distance value and the actual distance is affected by the 5V supply voltage (deviations in the supply voltage result in deviations in the distance values) and is non-linear (resolution is bigger at close range).
If you want to get the distance value periodically, it is recommended to use the callback and set the period with .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUS.SetDistanceCallbackPeriod(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Sets the period in ms with which the callback is triggered periodically. A value of 0 turns the callback off.
Der callback is only triggered if the distance value has changed since the last triggering.
The default value is 0.

"'x'", "Callback is turned off" "'o'", "Callback is triggered when the distance value is *outside* the min and max values" "'i'", "Callback is triggered when the distance value is *inside* the min and max values" "'<'", "Callback is triggered when the distance value is smaller than the min value (max is ignored)" "'>'", "Callback is triggered when the distance value is greater than the min value (max is ignored)"
The default value is ('x', 0, 0).

member.name: E:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUSV2.DistanceCallback
member.summary:
This callback is triggered periodically according to the configuration set by .
The parameter is the same as .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUSV2.#ctor(System.String,Tinkerforge.IPConnection)
member.summary: Creates an object with the unique device ID uid and adds it to the IPConnection ipcon.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUSV2.GetDistance
member.summary:
Returns the distance in mm.
If you want to get the value periodically, it is recommended to use the callback. You can set the callback configuration with .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUSV2.SetDistanceCallbackConfiguration(System.Int64,System.Boolean,System.Char,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
The period in ms is the period with which the callback is triggered periodically. A value of 0 turns the callback off.
If the `value has to change`-parameter is set to true, the callback is only triggered after the value has changed. If the value didn't change within the period, the callback is triggered immediately on change.
If it is set to false, the callback is continuously triggered with the period, independent of the value.
It is furthermore possible to constrain the callback with thresholds.
The `option`-parameter together with min/max sets a threshold for the callback.
The following options are possible:
"Option", "Description"
"'x'", "Threshold is turned off" "'o'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is *outside* the min and max values" "'i'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is *inside* or equal to the min and max values" "'<'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is smaller than the min value (max is ignored)" "'>'", "Threshold is triggered when the value is greater than the min value (max is ignored)"
If the option is set to 'x' (threshold turned off) the callback is triggered with the fixed period.
The default value is (0, false, 'x', 0, 0).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUSV2.GetDistanceCallbackConfiguration(System.Int64@,System.Boolean@,System.Char@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the callback configuration as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUSV2.SetUpdateRate(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the update rate to 2 Hz or 10 Hz.
With 2 Hz update rate the noise is about ±1mm, while with 10 Hz update rate the noise increases to about ±5mm.
The default update rate is 2 Hz.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUSV2.GetUpdateRate
member.summary: Returns the update rate as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUSV2.SetDistanceLEDConfig(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Configures the distance LED to be either turned off, turned on, blink in heartbeat mode or show the distance (brighter = object is nearer).
The default value is 3 (show distance).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUSV2.GetDistanceLEDConfig
member.summary: Returns the LED configuration as set by

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUSV2.GetSPITFPErrorCount(System.Int64@,System.Int64@,System.Int64@,System.Int64@)
member.summary:
Returns the error count for the communication between Brick and Bricklet.
The errors are divided into
* ACK checksum errors, * message checksum errors, * framing errors and * overflow errors.
The errors counts are for errors that occur on the Bricklet side. All Bricks have a similar function that returns the errors on the Brick side.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUSV2.SetBootloaderMode(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the bootloader mode and returns the status after the requested mode change was instigated.
You can change from bootloader mode to firmware mode and vice versa. A change from bootloader mode to firmware mode will only take place if the entry function, device identifier and CRC are present and correct.
This function is used by Brick Viewer during flashing. It should not be necessary to call it in a normal user program.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUSV2.GetBootloaderMode
member.summary: Returns the current bootloader mode, see .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUSV2.SetWriteFirmwarePointer(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Sets the firmware pointer for . The pointer has to be increased by chunks of size 64. The data is written to flash every 4 chunks (which equals to one page of size 256).
This function is used by Brick Viewer during flashing. It should not be necessary to call it in a normal user program.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUSV2.WriteFirmware(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Writes 64 Bytes of firmware at the position as written by before. The firmware is written to flash every 4 chunks.
You can only write firmware in bootloader mode.
This function is used by Brick Viewer during flashing. It should not be necessary to call it in a normal user program.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUSV2.SetStatusLEDConfig(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the status LED configuration. By default the LED shows communication traffic between Brick and Bricklet, it flickers once for every 10 received data packets.
You can also turn the LED permanently on/off or show a heartbeat.
If the Bricklet is in bootloader mode, the LED is will show heartbeat by default.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUSV2.GetStatusLEDConfig
member.summary: Returns the configuration as set by

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUSV2.GetChipTemperature
member.summary:
Returns the temperature in °C as measured inside the microcontroller. The value returned is not the ambient temperature!
The temperature is only proportional to the real temperature and it has bad accuracy. Practically it is only useful as an indicator for temperature changes.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUSV2.Reset
member.summary:
Calling this function will reset the Bricklet. All configurations will be lost.
After a reset you have to create new device objects, calling functions on the existing ones will result in undefined behavior!

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUSV2.WriteUID(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Writes a new UID into flash. If you want to set a new UID you have to decode the Base58 encoded UID string into an integer first.
We recommend that you use Brick Viewer to change the UID.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUSV2.ReadUID
member.summary: Returns the current UID as an integer. Encode as Base58 to get the usual string version.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDistanceUSV2.GetIdentity(System.String@,System.String@,System.Char@,System.Byte[]@,System.Byte[]@,System.Int32@)
member.summary:
Returns the UID, the UID where the Bricklet is connected to, the position, the hardware and firmware version as well as the device identifier.
The position can be 'a', 'b', 'c' or 'd'.
The device identifier numbers can be found :ref:`here <device_identifier>`. |device_identifier_constant|

member.name: E:Tinkerforge.BrickletDMX.FrameStartedCallback
member.summary:
This callback is triggered as soon as a new frame write is started. You should send the data for the next frame directly after this callback was triggered.
For an explanation of the general approach see .
This callback can be enabled via .
This callback can only be triggered in master mode.

member.name: E:Tinkerforge.BrickletDMX.FrameAvailableCallback
member.summary:
This callback is triggered in slave mode when a new frame was received from the DMX master and it can be read out. You have to read the frame before the master has written the next frame, see for more details.
The parameter is the frame number, it is increased by one with each received frame.
This callback can be enabled via .
This callback can only be triggered in slave mode.

member.name: E:Tinkerforge.BrickletDMX.FrameLowLevelCallback
member.summary:
This callback is called as soon as a new frame is available (written by the DMX master).
The size of the array is equivalent to the number of channels in the frame. Each byte represents one channel.
This callback can be enabled via .
This callback can only be triggered in slave mode.

member.name: E:Tinkerforge.BrickletDMX.FrameErrorCountCallback
member.summary: This callback is called if a new error occurs. It returns the current overrun and framing error count.

member.name: E:Tinkerforge.BrickletDMX.FrameCallback
member.summary:
This callback is called as soon as a new frame is available (written by the DMX master).
The size of the array is equivalent to the number of channels in the frame. Each byte represents one channel.
This callback can be enabled via .
This callback can only be triggered in slave mode.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDMX.#ctor(System.String,Tinkerforge.IPConnection)
member.summary: Creates an object with the unique device ID uid and adds it to the IPConnection ipcon.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDMX.SetDMXMode(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the DMX mode to either master or slave.
Calling this function sets frame number to 0.
The default value is 0 (master).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDMX.GetDMXMode
member.summary: Returns the DMX mode, as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDMX.WriteFrameLowLevel(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Writes a DMX frame. The maximum frame size is 512 byte. Each byte represents one channel.
The next frame can be written after the callback was called. The frame is double buffered, so a new frame can be written as soon as the writing of the prior frame starts.
The data will be transfered when the next frame duration ends, see .
Generic approach:
* Set the frame duration to a value that represents the number of frames per second you want to achieve. * Set channels for first frame. * Wait for the callback. * Set channels for next frame. * Wait for the callback. * and so on.
This approach ensures that you can set new DMX data with a fixed frame rate.
This function can only be called in master mode.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDMX.ReadFrameLowLevel(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Byte[]@,System.Int64@)
member.summary:
Returns the last frame that was written by the DMX master. The size of the array is equivalent to the number of channels in the frame. Each byte represents one channel.
The next frame is available after the callback was called.
Generic approach:
* Call to get first frame. * Wait for the callback. * Call to get second frame. * Wait for the callback. * and so on.
Instead of polling this function you can also use the callback. You can enable it with .
The frame number starts at 0 and it is increased by one with each received frame.
This function can only be called in slave mode.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDMX.SetFrameDuration(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the duration of a frame in ms.
Example: If you want to achieve 20 frames per second, you should set the frame duration to 50ms (50ms * 20 = 1 second).
If you always want to send a frame as fast as possible you can set this value to 0.
This setting is only used in master mode.
Default value: 100ms (10 frames per second).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDMX.GetFrameDuration
member.summary: Returns the frame duration as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDMX.GetFrameErrorCount(System.Int64@,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Returns the current number of overrun and framing errors.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDMX.SetCommunicationLEDConfig(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the communication LED configuration. By default the LED shows communication traffic, it flickers once for every 10 received data packets.
You can also turn the LED permanently on/off or show a heartbeat.
If the Bricklet is in bootloader mode, the LED is off.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDMX.GetCommunicationLEDConfig
member.summary: Returns the configuration as set by

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDMX.SetErrorLEDConfig(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the error LED configuration.
By default the error LED turns on if there is any error (see callback). If you call this function with the Show-Error option again, the LED will turn off until the next error occurs.
You can also turn the LED permanently on/off or show a heartbeat.
If the Bricklet is in bootloader mode, the LED is off.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDMX.GetErrorLEDConfig
member.summary: Returns the configuration as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDMX.SetFrameCallbackConfig(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Enables/Disables the different callbacks. By default the callback and callback are enabled while the callback and callback are disabled.
If you want to use the callback you can enable it and disable the cb:`Frame Available` callback at the same time. It becomes redundant in this case.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDMX.GetFrameCallbackConfig(System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Returns the frame callback config as set by .

member.summary:
Returns the error count for the communication between Brick and Bricklet.
The errors are divided into
* ACK checksum errors, * message checksum errors, * framing errors and * overflow errors.
The errors counts are for errors that occur on the Bricklet side. All Bricks have a similar function that returns the errors on the Brick side.

member.name: E:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButton.StateChangedCallback
member.summary:
This callback is called whenever a button is pressed.
Possible states for buttons are:
* 0 = pressed * 1 = released
Possible states for LEDs are:
* 0 = AutoToggleOn: Auto toggle enabled and LED on. * 1 = AutoToggleOff: Auto toggle enabled and LED off. * 2 = On: LED on (auto toggle is disabled). * 3 = Off: LED off (auto toggle is disabled).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButton.#ctor(System.String,Tinkerforge.IPConnection)
member.summary: Creates an object with the unique device ID uid and adds it to the IPConnection ipcon.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButton.SetLEDState(System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the state of the LEDs. Possible states are:
* 0 = AutoToggleOn: Enables auto toggle with initially enabled LED. * 1 = AutoToggleOff: Activates auto toggle with initially disabled LED. * 2 = On: Enables LED (auto toggle is disabled). * 3 = Off: Disables LED (auto toggle is disabled).
In auto toggle mode the LED is toggled automatically at each press of a button.
If you just want to set one of the LEDs and don't know the current state of the other LED, you can get the state with or you can use .
The default value is (1, 1).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButton.GetLEDState(System.Byte@,System.Byte@)
member.summary: Returns the current state of the LEDs, as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButton.GetButtonState(System.Byte@,System.Byte@)
member.summary:
Returns the current state for both buttons. Possible states are:
* 0 = pressed * 1 = released

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButton.SetSelectedLEDState(System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the state of the selected LED (0 or 1).
The other LED remains untouched.

member.name: E:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButtonV2.StateChangedCallback
member.summary:
This callback is called whenever a button is pressed.
Possible states for buttons are:
* 0 = pressed * 1 = released
Possible states for LEDs are:
* 0 = AutoToggleOn: Auto toggle enabled and LED on. * 1 = AutoToggleOff: Auto toggle enabled and LED off. * 2 = On: LED on (auto toggle is disabled). * 3 = Off: LED off (auto toggle is disabled).
This callback can be enabled with .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButtonV2.#ctor(System.String,Tinkerforge.IPConnection)
member.summary: Creates an object with the unique device ID uid and adds it to the IPConnection ipcon.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButtonV2.SetLEDState(System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the state of the LEDs. Possible states are:
* 0 = AutoToggleOn: Enables auto toggle with initially enabled LED. * 1 = AutoToggleOff: Activates auto toggle with initially disabled LED. * 2 = On: Enables LED (auto toggle is disabled). * 3 = Off: Disables LED (auto toggle is disabled).
In auto toggle mode the LED is toggled automatically at each press of a button.
If you just want to set one of the LEDs and don't know the current state of the other LED, you can get the state with or you can use .
The default value is (1, 1).

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButtonV2.GetLEDState(System.Byte@,System.Byte@)
member.summary: Returns the current state of the LEDs, as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButtonV2.GetButtonState(System.Byte@,System.Byte@)
member.summary:
Returns the current state for both buttons. Possible states are:
* 0 = pressed * 1 = released

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButtonV2.SetSelectedLEDState(System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the state of the selected LED (0 or 1).
The other LED remains untouched.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButtonV2.SetStateChangedCallbackConfiguration(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
If you enable this callback, the callback is triggered every time a button is pressed/released
By default this callback is disabled.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButtonV2.GetStateChangedCallbackConfiguration
member.summary: Returns the configuration as set by .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButtonV2.GetSPITFPErrorCount(System.Int64@,System.Int64@,System.Int64@,System.Int64@)
member.summary:
Returns the error count for the communication between Brick and Bricklet.
The errors are divided into
* ACK checksum errors, * message checksum errors, * framing errors and * overflow errors.
The errors counts are for errors that occur on the Bricklet side. All Bricks have a similar function that returns the errors on the Brick side.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButtonV2.SetBootloaderMode(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the bootloader mode and returns the status after the requested mode change was instigated.
You can change from bootloader mode to firmware mode and vice versa. A change from bootloader mode to firmware mode will only take place if the entry function, device identifier and CRC are present and correct.
This function is used by Brick Viewer during flashing. It should not be necessary to call it in a normal user program.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButtonV2.GetBootloaderMode
member.summary: Returns the current bootloader mode, see .

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButtonV2.SetWriteFirmwarePointer(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Sets the firmware pointer for . The pointer has to be increased by chunks of size 64. The data is written to flash every 4 chunks (which equals to one page of size 256).
This function is used by Brick Viewer during flashing. It should not be necessary to call it in a normal user program.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButtonV2.WriteFirmware(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Writes 64 Bytes of firmware at the position as written by before. The firmware is written to flash every 4 chunks.
You can only write firmware in bootloader mode.
This function is used by Brick Viewer during flashing. It should not be necessary to call it in a normal user program.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButtonV2.SetStatusLEDConfig(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Sets the status LED configuration. By default the LED shows communication traffic between Brick and Bricklet, it flickers once for every 10 received data packets.
You can also turn the LED permanently on/off or show a heartbeat.
If the Bricklet is in bootloader mode, the LED is will show heartbeat by default.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButtonV2.GetStatusLEDConfig
member.summary: Returns the configuration as set by

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButtonV2.GetChipTemperature
member.summary:
Returns the temperature in °C as measured inside the microcontroller. The value returned is not the ambient temperature!
The temperature is only proportional to the real temperature and it has bad accuracy. Practically it is only useful as an indicator for temperature changes.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButtonV2.Reset
member.summary:
Calling this function will reset the Bricklet. All configurations will be lost.
After a reset you have to create new device objects, calling functions on the existing ones will result in undefined behavior!

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButtonV2.WriteUID(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Writes a new UID into flash. If you want to set a new UID you have to decode the Base58 encoded UID string into an integer first.
We recommend that you use Brick Viewer to change the UID.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButtonV2.ReadUID
member.summary: Returns the current UID as an integer. Encode as Base58 to get the usual string version.

member.name: M:Tinkerforge.BrickletDualButtonV2.GetIdentity(System.String@,System.String@,System.Char@,System.Byte[]@,System.Byte[]@,System.Int32@)
member.summary:
Returns the UID, the UID where the Bricklet is connected to, the position, the hardware and firmware version as well as the device identifier.
The position can be 'a', 'b', 'c' or 'd'.
The device identifier numbers can be found :ref:`here <device_identifier>`. |device_identifier_constant|
